FuncDef:
The trunk-member unicast-frame send delay command configures a delay after which an interface is added to an Eth-Trunk interface in unicast scenarios.
The undo trunk-member unicast-frame send delay command restores the default configuration.
By default, an interface is added to an Eth-Trunk interface after a delay of 1500 ms in unicast scenarios.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a delay after which an interface is added to an Eth-Trunk interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 1000 to 300000, in ms.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When the link of an Eth-Trunk interface that has IP services or Layer 2 known unicast services configured recovers from faults and traffic needs to switch back to the recovered link, an interface has to wait for 1.5s before being added to the Eth-Trunk interface by default. This duration may fail to guarantee that the service forwarding entries are ready. To resolve this issue, run the unicast trunk-member delay command to configure a delay longer than 1.5s, so that the service forwarding entries have sufficient time to become ready before the interface is added.
